item.title: Michelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Librarians are the coolest people out there doing the hardest job out there on the frontlines. And every time I get to encounter or work with librarians, I'm always impressed by their sheer awesomeness." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Josh Bazell
item.description: "Ah, youth. It's like heroin you've smoked instead of snorted. Gone so fast you can't believe you still have to pay for it." -- Josh Bazell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Play it fuckin' loud!" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "God has no religion." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "We’re too much ourselves. Afraid of letting go of what we are, in case we are nothing, and holding on so tight, we lose everything else." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by clive barker
item.description: "We are all our own graveyards, I believe; we squat amongst the tombs of the people we were. If we're healthy, every day is a celebration, a Day of the Dead, in which we give thanks for the lives that we lived, and if we are neurotic we brood and mourn and wish that the past was still present." -- clive barker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Clive Barker
item.description: "She was a sea: and I had to swim in her." -- Clive Barker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Michelle add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "If I had my way we'd sleep every night all wrapped around each other like hibernating rattlesnakes." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Once, I was a poet, and, like all poets, I spent too long in the Kingdom of Dreams." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Michelle add a quote by George Moore
item.description: "We humans are more complicated than animals, and we love through the imagination." -- George Moore

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Washington Irving
item.description: "There is a sacredness in tears. They are not a mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love." -- Washington Irving

item.title: Michelle add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "We need to make books cool again. If you go home with somebody and they don't have books, don't fuck them." -- John Waters

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "The surest defense against Evil is extreme individualism, originality of thinking, whimsicality, even—if you will—eccentricity." -- Joseph Brodsky
